page.title: 01SUMMARY OF THE AREA.
page.content: The D-block 04440498 lies 12 miles south of Middlesbrough and 6 miles north-east of Northallerton.Three quarters of the D-block lies within the North York Moors National Park. From the flat plains leading to Teesside, the land rises steeply to a moorland area which reaches 300 metres above sea level.On the steep-sided hills grow mainly conifers. Some of these wooded areas belong to the Forestry Commision.The moorland is covered by bracken, heather and rough grassland.This area is composed of thick sandstones from the Deltaic series but during glacial times melt water poured over and these overflow channels are now valleys within the moorland.The area is rural and chiefly devoted to farming.Ingleby Arncliffe in the north-west corner is mainly a commuter village for Teesside.
